column4: Hi there, I've encountering strange Problems with Ubuntu 1004 Server LTS on our Servers and haven't found anything with google.
When I reboot a machine, then all the net-interfaces seem to come up correctly - the routes are properly set, the IPs are up and so on.
But the machine is not reachable nor can it ping somewhere.
Only after issuing a /etc/init.d/networking restart everything works.
are u on the corrent subnet?
It is a complete normal out-of-the-box setup Server and it is connected to a Cisco switch, which filters nothing.
if your on the same subnet but  u cannot recive icmp packets there must be a firewall/filter
No, it isn't. The point is, that it only does not work after a reboot and this initial net-device initialisation. As soon as I issue a networking restart, everything works.
wow thats weird u restart and it works?
